title: Culture and Mental Health
description: (Cross-listed with GLBH 150.) This course reviews mental health cross-culturally and transnationally. Issues examined are cultural shaping of the interpretation, experience, symptoms, treatment, course, and recovery of mental illness. World Health Organization findings of better outcome in non-European and North American countries are explored. Students may not receive credit for GLBH 150 and ANSC 150. Prerequisites: upper-division standing.
